turns.content: Do adjunct professors have access to benefits such as health insurance or retirement plans through the university?

Adjunct professors may be eligible for some benefits such as health insurance or retirement plans, depending on the policies of the university. However, the eligibility and extent of these benefits can vary widely, and part-time faculty members are often not offered the same benefits as full-time employees. It is important for adjunct professors to check with their respective universities to understand their specific benefits package.
